posts.name: Belle Isle Seafood
posts.note: Belle Isle Seafood is a local seafood, including chowder and lobster rolls, in a spare, industrial space with inlet views. I ordered their fried Seafood Combo which had fried fish, shrimp, scallops, and I think clams along with French fries and cole slaw. No one can eat all the food you get by themselves. I'm glad I had help finishing it off.

posts.name: Blunch
posts.note: The Blunch breakfast and lunch counter is turning out hearty pressed sandwiches and chocolate chip cookies until late.

posts.name: Bob’s Lobster
posts.note: Bob’s Lobster is a rough-and-ready fish market and seafood shack with river views along with a cozy, laid-back vibe.

posts.name: Cabot’s Ice Cream
posts.note: Cabot’s Ice Cream is a family-friendly diner with dozens of ice cream flavors and three square meals in a nostalgic setting. Order the peanut butter fluff boat.

posts.name: Cutty’s
posts.note: Cutty’s uses locally sourced, and made-in-house ingredients define this busy breakfast-lunch soup and sandwich joint. You need to get one of the pork sandwiches. Cutty's makes home-made pickled fennel for the pork fennel sandwich.

posts.name: Durgin-Park
posts.note: Durgin-Park is a historic eatery serving hearty portions of classic New England fare and a wide range of craft beers. You should order the prime rib.

posts.name: Little Donkey
posts.note: Little Donkey is a chef-driven spot with cool vibe serving international small plates, along with craft beers and cocktails.

posts.name: Maria's Pastry Shop
posts.note: Maria's Pastry Shop is an unassuming Italian baker is offering acclaimed sweets such as cannoli, torrone, and marzipan.

posts.name: Mike's Pastry
posts.note: Mike's Pastry is a renowned Italian bake shop is providing cannoli in multiple flavors, gelati, and biscotti since 1946. Mike's has some of the best cannoli I have ever had. On top of that, they are huge. NOTE: They have multiple locations.
posts.cptn: Chocolate mouse with chocolate chip cannoli and a ricotta cannoli from Mike!s Pastry in Boston's North End.

posts.name: Salumeria Italiana
posts.note: Salumeria Italiana is a quaint fixture selling a range of Italian groceries, including meats, cheeses, pasta, and sauces. They supposedly have the best head cheese/Coppa di Testa in the country.

posts.name: Red Lentil Vegetarian and Vegan Restaurant
posts.note: Red Lentil Vegetarian and Vegan Restaurant is a destination that serves vegetarian and vegan Indian food with seasonal ingredients with gluten-free options, along with wine, and beer.

posts.name: Roxy's Grilled Cheese
posts.note: Roxy's Grilled Cheese is a cheery spin-off of a popular food truck with inventive grilled cheese sandwiches, poutine, and burgers. Don't forget to go through walk-in cooler door to the old school pinball arcade. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Veggie Galaxy
posts.note: Veggie Galaxy is an imaginative twist on an old-school diner specializing in from-scratch vegan and vegetarian options. I ordered the Pearl Street Redhead Omelette (Portobellos, Caramelized Onion, Feta, Roasted Red Pepper Sauce) and don't forget to ask for their home-made hot sauce it's got the perfect amount of heat and spice for flavor.
